title: Deutsche Bank Moves Hundreds of Employees From Russia to Berlin
sub_head: German lender offered Russian employees and their families to relocate to a new tech development hub
body:
Deutsche Bank AG relocated hundreds of employees from its technology center in Russia to Berlin and decided to make the German capital a tech center for its investment and corporate banking activities.
The German lender offered the roughly 1,500 staff who were in Russia the chance to move to Berlin with their families, and about half accepted, according to a person familiar with the move. The bank hasnâ€™t decided what will happen to the Russian center and the staff who decided to stay. Their main task is to develop and maintain software for trading and corporate banking.
